alert.note: Alert for Starr (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 28 at 11:28PM CDT until April 29 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Deep South Texas, including the following county, Starr. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1128 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roma, Escobares, El Sauz, Viboras, La Rosita, Roma High School, North Escobares, Garceno, Roma Creek, Roma Public Library, Roma City Hall, Roma City Police Department, Los Alvarez, Barrera Elementary School, Salineno, Falcon Heights, Roma Park, Falcon State Park and Rio Grande City--roma. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
